intro: Aconitum aquilonare, commonly known as the Alpine monkshood, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer, typically from July to August. The plant features palmately lobed leaves that are deeply divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained, loamy soils and prefers partial to full shade. Aconitum aquilonare is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, known for its toxic alkaloids, making it a plant that requires careful handling.
